Context:
The International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is a popular English language proficiency test for higher education and global migration. IELTS assesses English skills in reading, writing, listening, and speaking. Applicants should determine which test they require based on their intended use of the results (emigration, visa applications, post-secondary or postgraduate opportunities).

Services and contact information for IELTS at George Brown College:
- Location: 341 King St. E., Room 419, Toronto ON M5A 1L1, Canada
- Contact: ielts@georgebrown.ca, 416-415-5000 ext. 2564
- Hours of operation: Tuesday to Thursday 8:30 a.m. to 2 p.m., Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
- Additional services and resources: Learn more about IELTS, register for tests, and sign up for college news and updates.

Please note that information on this website is subject to change without notice. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
